meanings.definition: A large motor vehicle designed to carry passengers along a fixed route.
meanings.sent1: The omnibuses in the city are always crowded during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: I took the omnibuses to get to work this morning.
meanings.sent3: The omnibuses seemed to be playing a game of musical chairs with the passengers.
meanings.sent4: The omnibuses roared down the street like giant metal beasts.
meanings.sent5: The bright red omnibuses stood out against the gray buildings.

meanings.definition: A collection of literary works or musical compositions.
meanings.sent1: The library had a vast collection of omnibuses from different authors.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the omnibuses of classic poetry.
meanings.sent3: The omnibuses on the bookshelf whispered stories to each other at night.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an omnibuses of creative ideas waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The omnibuses of music filled the concert hall with beautiful melodies.
